text:
Andros Townsend fights to save Crystal Palace career as Newcastle monitor winger's situation The England international has struggled to impress new Eagles boss Sam Allardyce Share Townsend has not impressed Allardyce (Photo: Richard Heathcote) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Andros Townsend is fighting to save his Crystal Palace career - and could be ready to make a sensational return to Newcastle. 
England winger Townsend, 25, has struggled to impress new Palace boss Sam Allardyce and Newcastle are watching developments closely. 
Townsend left Newcastle just six months ago following relegation after Palace met his £13m buy-out clause. 
But Townsend has struggled to make a big impact at Selhurst Park and Allardyce has now given him a major pep talk to try and get him going. Newcastle are monitoring Townsend's situation (Photo: Ian Walton) 
Allardyce was hoping that Townsend would be a big hit under his management but his form has been a big concern. 
Palace have already signed Jeffrey Schlupp from Leicester for £12m and he is expected to play on the left wing rather than at left back. 
That has raised questions on Townsend’s future and Allardyce could be ready to cash in with Newcastle set to make a move given any encouragement. 
Palace, who are hoping to complete a £6m deal for Arsenal’s Carl Jenkinson, are also interested in Juventus’s former Manchester United left back Patrice Evra, 35. Big Sam is looking at defensive reinforcements (Photo: Getty) 
There is likely to be more comings and goings at Palace before the end of the window and Townsend knows he could be on the move. 
Newcastle boss Rafa Benitez has not denied that Townsend could be a target but it will depend on whether Palace decide to sell.
